body:
Implemented a quality review process that targets files identified in `.jules/review_data/diffs.txt`.
Created a new script `scripts/generate_quality_review.py` which checks for:
- God Functions (>200 lines Critical, >100 Major)
- DRY Violations (>5 Critical, >2 Major)
- Secrets (Critical)
- Broad Exception Handling (Major/Critical)
- Magic Numbers (Major)

Generated the assessment report at `docs/assessments/Assessment_Quality_Review.md` which lists 10 Critical issues found in the codebase.

---
*PR created automatically by Jules for task [8958254898234883539](https://jules.google.com/task/8958254898234883539) started by @dieterolson*

<!-- CURSOR_SUMMARY -->
---

> [!NOTE]
> **Medium Risk**
> Mostly adds new reporting artifacts and an offline analysis script, but it also changes a GitHub Actions workflow that pushes commits to PR branches, which could affect automation behavior if rebases encounter conflicts.
> 
> **Overview**
> Adds `scripts/generate_quality_review.py`, which scans Python files referenced by `.jules/review_data/diffs.txt` for heuristic quality problems (oversized functions, duplicate blocks, broad `except Exception`, magic-number density, and potential hardcoded secrets) and emits both `docs/assessments/Assessment_Quality_Review.md` and `docs/assessments/assessment_quality_review.json`.
> 
> Also updates the PR comment responder workflow to `git pull --rebase` the PR branch before pushing automated â€œaddress commentsâ€ commits, and refreshes the existing Pragmatic Programmer assessment outputs under `docs/assessments/pragmatic_programmer/`.
> 
> <sup>Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit b918ef39931f3facb4f37d08fac49a74be49b0c4. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).</sup>
<!-- /CURSOR_SUMMARY -->

When you start a review, I'll add a ðŸ‘€ emoji to each comment to let you know I've read it. I'll focus on feedback directed at me and will do my best to stay out of conversations between you and other bots or reviewers to keep the noise down.

I'll push a commit with your requested changes shortly after. Please note there might be a delay between these steps, but rest assured I'm on the job!

For more direct control, you can switch me to **Reactive Mode**. When this mode is on, I will only act on comments where you specifically mention me with `@jules`. You can find this option in the **Pull Request** section of your [global Jules UI settings](https://jules.google.com/settings). You can always switch back!

New to Jules? Learn more at [jules.google/docs](https://jules.google/docs).

I've addressed the review comments. Please take another look!

reviews.body:
## Pull request overview This PR implements an automated quality review system that analyzes Python files identified in `.jules/review_data/diffs.txt` and generates assessment reports highlighting code quality issues. **Changes:** - Created a quality review script that detects god functions, DRY violations, hardcoded secrets, broad exception handling, and magic numbers - Generated assessment reports in both Markdown and JSON formats documenting 10 critical issues and numerous major issues - Updated the pragmatic programmer review documentation with new duplicate code findings ### Reviewed changes Copilot reviewed 5 out of 5 changed files in this pull request and generated 5 comments.
Show a summary per file | File | Description | | ---- | ----------- | | scripts/generate_quality_review.py | New script implementing quality checks with configurable severity thresholds | | docs/assessments/Assessment_Quality_Review.md | Generated markdown report listing 10 critical and multiple major quality issues | | docs/assessments/assessment_quality_review.json | Machine-readable JSON output of all detected quality issues | | docs/assessments/pragmatic_programmer/review.md | Updated with newly detected DRY violation and timestamp | | docs/assessments/pragmatic_programmer/review.json | Updated JSON data reflecting new DRY violation detection |

title: Quality Review of Review Data
